channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: NZ's moves towards becoming a tech hub
item.description: The Detail: Auckland will host an international conference next year on cyber security, as the country tries to take advantage of its trusted reputation to make waves in the technology space.

item.title: Bryce Edwards: where's the contest of ideas this campaign?
item.description: Analysis - Can we postpone this year's election? We've ended up with a campaign focused on scandal, personality and leadership, with a policy void that's worse than usual.

item.title: 'The trauma was quite acute': In court, residents recall early moments of 2017 Port Hills fire
item.description: Witnesses have recalled the traumatic early moments of the 2017 Port Hills fire in the High Court in Christchurch today.

item.title: Positive start to Ōpōtiki’s first Tuia Programme
item.description: Ōpōtiki's first Tuia Programme is already producing positive results amongst the community's youth.

item.title: Hamilton City Council to use new voting system
item.description: Councillors who were elected under the First Past the Post system have voted to switch to the Single Transferable Voting system for the 2022 and 2025 elections.

item.title: SH1 closed at Hikurangi after pedestrian killed in Northland
item.description: One person has died after a car hit a pedestrian on State Highway One in Northland tonight.

item.title: Milford locals tested for Covid-19 after visit from infected traveller
item.description: About 30 Milford workers and residents have been tested for Covid-19 after a visit from a traveller who tested positive in South Korea.

item.title: Grace Millane murderer's appeal, day 1: Lawyer focuses on consent
item.description: The lawyer acting for the man convicted of Grace Millane's murder focused on the issue of consent today at the appeal hearing of his conviction and sentence.

item.title: Antarctica New Zealand's efforts to prevent Covid-19 from reaching the southern continent
item.description: Antarctica New Zealand will reduce personnel flying south and all will isolate for 14 days to prevent Covid-19 from reaching the southern continent.

item.title: Southland Charity Hospital's new partnership allows in-person donations
item.description: The hospital - the dream of cancer care advocate Blair Vining, who died last October - has been selling bricks for the path to its car park, and commemorative plaques.

item.title: Safety precautions not heeded in fatal Hawke's Bay helicopter crash - judge
item.description: A helicopter company has pleaded guilty to operating an aircraft carelessly during a fatal crash in Hawke's Bay in 2018.

item.title: Waipukurau library fails earthquake standards despite strengthening
item.description: Waipukurau's library fails to meet earthquake standards, despite significant strengthening work carried out five years ago, a new report has found.

item.title: Man who murdered Grace Millane did not get fair trial, lawyer argues
item.description: The lawyer said the appeal did not seek to condone the man's "inexcusable" actions, it was about whether the trial process was miscarried.

item.title: More farmers to be covered by regional drought relief fund
item.description: The Hawke's Bay Rural Advisory Group has broadened the eligibility criteria of the regional drought relief fund to support more farmers.

item.title: Covid updates are prudent, not a campaign strategy - Health Minister
item.description: Checkpoint - Health Minister Chris Hipkins talks about why we're being told to buy masks, and the Covid Card to be trailled in Rotorua.

item.title: Privacy breaches at Immigration NZ: 'We open up our whole lives to them'
item.description: A couple fear a privacy breach at Immigration New Zealand show safeguards on personal information are not adequate.

item.title: Residential Tenancies Amendment Bill: How it will affect tenants and landlords
item.description: Tenants now have another layer of security with the passing of the Residential Tenancies Amendment Bill.

item.title: Bill to strengthen renters' rights passes final reading in Parliament
item.description: A bill that increases security and stability for tenants has passed its final reading in Parliament.
